pull_request.title: Support alternate tag prefixes
pull_request.body:
We should support alternate prefixes in version tags. At the moment the project assumes that the prefix `v` is always used. But some projects use no prefix, or include the package as a prefix to the version (e.g. in monorepos).

All public-facing functions now support a tag prefix option. It is optional, so this is a non-breaking change. The `updateChangelog`
method accepts an array of tag prefixes instead of a single one, so that we can better support the first release of a monorepo where you might want to compare against a backup tag if the first isn't found.

Fixes #116

repo.name: auto-changelog
repo.description: Utilities for validating and updating "Keep a Changelog" formatted changelogs

repo.name: auto-changelog
repo.description: Utilities for validating and updating "Keep a Changelog" formatted changelogs

issue.title: Support monorepos without synchronized versions
issue.body: Currently this action only supports monorepos with synchronized versions. We will soon be using monorepos that don't use synchronized versions, so this will need to be updated to support that.

pull_request.title: Support monorepos with independent versions
pull_request.body:
This changes functionality to support MetaMask monorepos with an independent versioning strategy.

closes: #45

issue.title: Support monorepos with independent versions
issue.body:
This changes functionality to support MetaMask monorepos with an independent versioning strategy.

closes: #45

comment.body:
I also tested this on a version of `snaps-monorepo` where I added `release.config.json` with an `"independent"` `.versioningStrategy` and that appears to have run correctly:

- It correctly ran the newly added `get-release-packages.sh` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:24)
- It correctly determined the `RELEASE_STRATEGY` as `independent` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:264)
- It correctly got a complete list of the packages to be published (in this case all since I did this with `Create Release Pull Request`) [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:267)
- It correctly created a single version tag and individual tags for each package [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/tags)

pull_request.title: Bump actions
pull_request.body:
This bumps all our actions to the latest versions to get the `set-output` deprecation warning out of CI

`action-create-release-pr` doesn't need a bump because `v1` is now `1.4.3`

You can see that working without any warnings [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/controllers/actions/runs/3364652649)

You can also see the entire release flow working without any warnings [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/controllers/actions/runs/3364681840)

repo.name: controllers
repo.description: Collection of platform-agnostic modules for creating secure data models for cryptocurrency wallets

issue.body:
This bumps all our actions to the latest versions to get the `set-output` deprecation warning out of CI

`action-create-release-pr` doesn't need a bump because `v1` is now `1.4.3`

You can see that working without any warnings [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/controllers/actions/runs/3364652649)

comment.body:
> I'm curious to know why we used specific versions in these places only.

looks like it was my doing and I don't think there was a reason for it?

for `MetaMask/action-publish-release` we could also just pin that to `@v2`: https://github.com/MetaMask/action-publish-release/releases/tag/v2

pull_request.title: Bump `@actions/core`
pull_request.body:
I'm still seeing a `set-output` deprecation in ci after the most recent bump :upside_down_face: 

This is because there is a `setOutput` call in `actions/core` that's been updated in https://github.com/actions/toolkit/pull/1178

So this bump takes care of that. I've also tested this in my fork and the deprecation notice is now gone.

pull_request.title: Support alternate tag prefixes
pull_request.body:
We should support alternate prefixes in version tags. At the moment the project assumes that the prefix `v` is always used. But some projects use no prefix, or include the package as a prefix to the version (e.g. in monorepos).

All public-facing functions now support a tag prefix option. It is optional, so this is a non-breaking change. The `updateChangelog`
method accepts an array of tag prefixes instead of a single one, so that we can better support the first release of a monorepo where you might want to compare against a backup tag if the first isn't found.

Fixes #116

issue.title: Support monorepos with independent versions
issue.body:
This changes functionality to support MetaMask monorepos with an independent versioning strategy.

closes: #45

comment.body:
I also tested this on a version of `snaps-monorepo` where I added `release.config.json` with an `"independent"` `.versioningStrategy` and that appears to have run correctly:

- It correctly ran the newly added `get-release-packages.sh` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:24)
- It correctly determined the `RELEASE_STRATEGY` as `independent` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:264)
- It correctly got a complete list of the packages to be published (in this case all since I did this with `Create Release Pull Request`) [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:267)
- It correctly created a single version tag and individual tags for each package [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/tags)

pull_request.title: Bump actions
pull_request.body:
This bumps all our actions to the latest versions to get the `set-output` deprecation warning out of CI

`action-create-release-pr` doesn't need a bump because `v1` is now `1.4.3`

You can see that working without any warnings [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/controllers/actions/runs/3364652649)

You can also see the entire release flow working without any warnings [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/controllers/actions/runs/3364681840)

pull_request.title: Bump `@actions/core`
pull_request.body:
I'm still seeing a `set-output` deprecation in ci after the most recent bump :upside_down_face: 

This is because there is a `setOutput` call in `actions/core` that's been updated in https://github.com/actions/toolkit/pull/1178

So this bump takes care of that. I've also tested this in my fork and the deprecation notice is now gone.

pull_request.title: Support alternate tag prefixes
pull_request.body:
We should support alternate prefixes in version tags. At the moment the project assumes that the prefix `v` is always used. But some projects use no prefix, or include the package as a prefix to the version (e.g. in monorepos).

All public-facing functions now support a tag prefix option. It is optional, so this is a non-breaking change. The `updateChangelog`
method accepts an array of tag prefixes instead of a single one, so that we can better support the first release of a monorepo where you might want to compare against a backup tag if the first isn't found.

Fixes #116

repo.name: auto-changelog
repo.description: Utilities for validating and updating "Keep a Changelog" formatted changelogs

repo.name: auto-changelog
repo.description: Utilities for validating and updating "Keep a Changelog" formatted changelogs

issue.title: Support monorepos without synchronized versions
issue.body: Currently this action only supports monorepos with synchronized versions. We will soon be using monorepos that don't use synchronized versions, so this will need to be updated to support that.

pull_request.title: Support monorepos with independent versions
pull_request.body:
This changes functionality to support MetaMask monorepos with an independent versioning strategy.

closes: #45

issue.title: Support monorepos with independent versions
issue.body:
This changes functionality to support MetaMask monorepos with an independent versioning strategy.

closes: #45

comment.body:
I also tested this on a version of `snaps-monorepo` where I added `release.config.json` with an `"independent"` `.versioningStrategy` and that appears to have run correctly:

- It correctly ran the newly added `get-release-packages.sh` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:24)
- It correctly determined the `RELEASE_STRATEGY` as `independent` [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:264)
- It correctly got a complete list of the packages to be published (in this case all since I did this with `Create Release Pull Request`) [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/actions/runs/3379184167/jobs/5610407904#step:5:267)
- It correctly created a single version tag and individual tags for each package [here](https://github.com/rickycodes/snaps-monorepo/tags)

pull_request.title: Bump `@actions/core`
pull_request.body:
I'm still seeing a `set-output` deprecation in ci after the most recent bump :upside_down_face: 

This is because there is a `setOutput` call in `actions/core` that's been updated in https://github.com/actions/toolkit/pull/1178

So this bump takes care of that. I've also tested this in my fork and the deprecation notice is now gone.

pull_request.title: Bump `@actions/core`
pull_request.body:
I'm still seeing a `set-output` deprecation in ci after the most recent bump :upside_down_face: 

This is because there is a `setOutput` call in `actions/core` that's been updated in https://github.com/actions/toolkit/pull/1178

So this bump takes care of that. I've also tested this in my fork and the deprecation notice is now gone.
This is the release candidate for version 32.0.3.

pull_request.title: Add slack-github-action
pull_request.body:
This will announce when a workflow run needs review/approval on Slack

TODO:

- [ ] <strike>add `slackapi/slack-github-action@v1.22.0` to org list of approved GitHub Actions</strike>
- [ ] <strike>add `secrets.SLACK_BOT_TOKEN` to repository (who do I talk to about this?)</strike>
- [x] consider maybe adding this as a config option to `action-npm-publish` so we don't have to paste this block everywhere?

re: https://github.com/MetaMask/action-npm-publish/issues/6
